docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Dec. 9 -- At the end of a Cabinet council today lasting two hours, under the chairmanship of Acting President Ramon S. Castillo, a decree was announced whereby, in accordance with a communique issued by the Ministry of...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Dec. 9 -- At the end of a Cabinet council today lasting two hours, under the chairmanship of Acting President Ramon S. Castillo, a decree was announced whereby, in accordance with a communique issued by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs yesterday, Argentina will not treat the United States as a belligerent.
docs.abstract: Argentine Embassy takes over interests in Tokyo

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 -- Japanese firms and individuals in the American republics tonight were put by the State Department on a blacklist and so denied the benefits of American trade. Similar action, has previously been taken with reference to...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 -- Japanese firms and individuals in the American republics tonight were put by the State Department on a blacklist and so denied the benefits of American trade. Similar action, has previously been taken with reference to individuals and firms having German and Italian business connections.
docs.abstract: Jap firms added to U S blacklist in Latin Amer

docs.snippet: Records undoubtedly will be smashed when a galaxy of stars competes this afternoon in the first open swimming meet of the Winter, sponsored by the Women's Swimming Association in its pool in West Twenty-fourth Street.
docs.lead_paragraph: Records undoubtedly will be smashed when a galaxy of stars competes this afternoon in the first open swimming meet of the Winter, sponsored by the Women's Swimming Association in its pool in West Twenty-fourth Street.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 -- The following foreign service changes since Dec. 6 were announced by the State Department today: H. Merie Cothran, Tucson, Ariz., assigned for duty in the Dept. of State.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 13 -- The following foreign service changes since Dec. 6 were announced by the State Department today: H. Merie Cothran, Tucson, Ariz., assigned for duty in the Dept. of State.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: War in the Pacific had a mixed effect on the foreign exchange last week, with the Chinese currencies holding steady around prevailing levels, while the South Americans showed gains at the expense of a corresponding decline in the American dollar.
docs.lead_paragraph: War in the Pacific had a mixed effect on the foreign exchange last week, with the Chinese currencies holding steady around prevailing levels, while the South Americans showed gains at the expense of a corresponding decline in the American dollar.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES WEEK ENDED DEC. 13, 1941
